newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht rallies late, interbank rate eases.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht rallies late, interbank rate eases.

text.p: The Thai baht rallied against a steadily weakening dollar in major foreign exchange markets in late Thursday trade, dealers said.
"People began selling dollar in the afternoon after its sharp fall against the yen," a dealer at a foreign bank.
The baht firmed to 26.050/26.055 to the dollar late from 26.069/26.074 in early morning trade, dealers said.
The Bank of Thailand fixed the baht/dollar mid-rate at 26.05 against 26.06 on Wednesday.
But the market was cautious against being caught short on dollar on a possible outflow of foreign funds in the wake of the stock market's sustained weakness, dealers said.
"Heavy foreign selling in the stock market triggered speculation of possible fund outflows. Some players were reluctant to be short on dollar," a dealer said.
Thai stocks extended their big losses, tumbling another 2.00 percent on Thursday with the market index falling to its lowest close since January 1991.
The SET Index ended down 12.51 points to 614.06 at the finish.
The overnight interbank rate fell to 8.50-9.00 percent in late trade from 9.00-9.50 in early morning on limited demand for funds to meet new bank reserves, dealers said.
The one-month swap premium was traded at 5.50/6.00 satangs per dollar late against 6.00/6.50 in the morning, dealers said.
